dr.evolution.datatype
Class SimpleCodons

java.lang.Object
  dr.evolution.datatype.DataType
      dr.evolution.datatype.SimpleCodons
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SimpleCodons
extends DataType

Implements DataType for codons Codons have tree different representations: State numbers - 0-63 + 64, 65 as unknown and gap State chars - the above converted into chars, starting at 'A' and '?' + '-' for unknown and gap Strings or chars of three nucleotide characters

Version:
$Id: SimpleCodons.java,v 1.1 2005/06/28 11:51:50 rambaut Exp $
Author:
Andrew Rambaut, Alexei Drummond
See Also:

getValidChars

public char[] getValidChars()
Description copied from class: DataType
return the set of valid chars if they are defined, if not defined then return null cannot use stateCount and loop, because some data types stateCount is dynamic.
